http://www-personal.umich.edu/~daniong/ >>>>>>> b27b8f271bcd8b5664f9af99f86a6754cdc374ab PhD candidate in the Department of Statistics at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor My broad research interests are in applying interpretable statistical and machine learning methods to gain insight from scientific data in a wide range of fields. In particular, I am interested in Bayesian models, latent variable models, and computational algorithms to fit these complex models. Read about what I have been recently working on below!
